intro: Cicerbita duthieana, commonly known as the Duthie's bittercress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces slender, cylindrical pods that contain the seeds. Cicerbita duthieana is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often lobed or divided.
